name: Safety of Dams on Indian Lands
objective: To improve the structural integrity of dams on Indian lands, including operations and maintenance of these dams.
applicant_types: Native American Organizations (includes Indian groups, cooperatives, corporations, partnerships, associations)

results.description: IA fulfilled its program objectives by issuing approximately eight (8) Self-Determination Awards to support the safety of dams on Indian lands in FY20.
Indian Affairs  issued 15 new awards and modifications to existing awards to 12 recipients.
This award funded 25 programs to provide maintenances on high hazard or significant dams, irrigation rehab, design and construction.

authorizations.text: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, Public Law 93-638, as amended, 25 U.S.C. 450; Snyder Act of 1921, 25 U.S.C. 13, Public Law 67-85, 42 Stat. 208; Indian Dams Safety Act of 1994, Public Law 103-302, 108 Stat. 1560; Secretarial Order No. 3048.

rules_regulations: 25 CFR Part 900; and Department of the Interior Safety of Dams (SOD) Program.
